attributes.action: posthumously award Mr Leigh Pitt the George Cross.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Leigh Pitt died in June 2007 while saving a boy from drowning in a canal in Thamesmead, southeast London.

Mr Pitt managed to keep the child above water while passers-by threw a line. Mr Pitt was unable to stay afloat and drowned before he himself could be saved.

Mr Pitt selflessly put his own life at risk to save a child and his example should be honoured and remembered by awarding him posthumously the highest award for civilian bravery.
